title: Speed, Velocity and Distance
content:
Speed, Velocity and Distance

The Hook

Did you know that a local train in Mumbai travels at around 80 km/h, but an express train on the Delhi–Mumbai route can reach 130 km/h? Both travel a distance, but at very different speeds. What if the train reverses? That's where velocity comes in!

The Concept

Speed tells you how fast an object moves: Speed = Distance ÷ Time. Velocity is speed with a direction — for example, 60 km/h towards Chennai. An object's velocity changes if its speed changes or if its direction changes. Distance is the total path covered; displacement is the shortest straight-line distance from start to finish.

The Illustration

Imagine you walk 4 km to school and 4 km back home. Your total distance is 8 km — but your displacement is zero, because you're back where you started. The school bus travels at a speed of 40 km/h, but its velocity is 40 km/h towards the north gate.
